briefTitle: Evaluation of Memantine Versus Placebo on Ischemic Stroke Outcome

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Presentation at first 24hrs of disease onset
* Confirmation of ischemic stroke in MCA territory by imaging.
* Accepted consent form

Exclusion Criteria:

* Allergy history to memantine
* Stage 4 -5 renal failure base on Acute Kidney Injury Network criteria
* Moderate to severe hepatic failure (Child-Pugh criteria, grade B and C)
* History of epilepsy
* History of dementia
* History of memantine use in recent 6 months
* Pregnancy or breastfeeding
* Severe drug adverse effects

outcomeMeasures.title: Investigation of Neurological Deficit by National Institute of Health Scale Score (NIHSS)
outcomeMeasures.description: The National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale, or NIH Stroke Scale (NIHSS) is a tool used by healthcare providers to objectively quantify the impairment caused by a stroke. The NIHSS is composed of 11 items, each of which scores a specific ability between a 0 and 4. For each item, a score of 0 typically indicates normal function in that specific ability, while a higher score is indicative of some level of impairment. The individual scores from each item are summed in order to calculate a patient's total NIHSS score. The maximum possible score is 42, with the minimum score being a 0. Higher score is indicative of some level of impairment in neurological function.

outcomeMeasures.title: Investigation of Disability by Modified Rankin Scale (mRS)
outcomeMeasures.description:
The modified Rankin Scale (mRS) is a commonly used scale for measuring the degree of disability or dependence in the daily activities of people who have suffered a stroke or other causes of neurological disability.

The scale runs from 0-6, running from perfect health without symptoms to death.

0 - No symptoms.

1. \- No significant disability. Able to carry out all usual activities, despite some symptoms.
2. \- Slight disability. Able to look after own affairs without assistance, but unable to carry out all previous activities.
3. \- Moderate disability. Requires some help, but able to walk unassisted.
4. \- Moderately severe disability. Unable to attend to own bodily needs without assistance, and unable to walk unassisted.
5. \- Severe disability. Requires constant nursing care and attention, bedridden, incontinent.
6. \- Dead.
